section.title: Summary of Changes in RLS
section.para: The following changes have occurred for RLS since the last stable release, previousversion:

listitem.simpara: An embedded database (using SQLite) and ODBC libraries are now included in the RLS Server installation. A default installation of GT, will include a fully configured RLS Server that requires no database installation or configuration by the end user. Advanced users can still use their own database without changes.

The RLS now includes a new Java client API written entirely in Java. It does not require the C client libraries and allows for Java client support on 64-bit platforms. The new API is fully backward compatible. Users need not make any changes to existing code to take advantage of the new library.

The RLS Admin Guide has been completely rewritten to account for the embedded database support and to streamline the installation procedures. In addition, a large help section has been added based on an analysis of ODBC and database installation procedures and their compatibility with the RLS.

Client tools support for bulk operations has been improved. The globus-rls-cli can now read input parameters from a file, and a new globus-rls-bulk.sh script also simplifies repetitive procedures involving bulk operations.
Bug fixes up through the GT 4.0.6 release are also included in this release.
